repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Breaking change: `ts_node_child_containing_descendant()` was removed (but was introduced and superseded within the 0.11 dev cycle).

(Early testing for upcoming 0.25 release, which is a big one; the update will have to be backported since the ecosystem will quickly switch to ABI 15, making parsers unusable on Nvim 0.10 otherwise.)

Follow-up:

* [x] adapt to deprecations (`ts_language_abi_version`)
* [x] bump the minimal version to 0.25 (after release)
* [ ] expose `ts_language_metadata`, supertype info (?)
* [ ] migrate from `parser_timeout_micros` to callbacks

comment_data.body: This should be `v29.0.1`; script needs a bit of fixup, it seems.

Nit:

```suggestion
â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the Treesitter
```

I believe that no dash is the convention: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27110
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_data.body: Ah, "treesitter" is what we call the functionality it in our codebase, but the upstream project is still called "tree-sitter". So this is me making clear who's to blame here ;)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_data.body: Well FWIW the rest of this file uses "Treesitter", so let's at least try to aim for file consistency ðŸ˜…
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_data.body: Yes but the rest of the file is not literally talking about the upstream project.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_data.body: Oh I see. I think that the use of "Treesitter library" already makes that clear, but I'll let you decide.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_data.body: (This is temporary in any case, since it's a HEAD-only change so won't survive the next release.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,12 @@ OPTIONS
 â€¢ 'jumpoptions' flag "unload" has been renamed to "clean".
 â€¢ The `msghistory` option has been removed in favor of 'messagesopt'.
 
+TREESITTER
+
+â€¢ *TSNode:child_containing_descendant()* has been removed in the tree-sitter

comment_regular_data.body:
BSD failure is from https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/pull/3740

**EDIT:** Fixed by https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/pull/4149

This is now officially the release candidate for 0.25, so I'm going to merge this so we can catch any regressions _before_ release (expected in a week or so).

Note: needs to be squashed since tree-sitter and wasmtime versions have to match.

Manual backport needed (after the actual release).

title: build(deps)!: bump tree-sitter to HEAD
